facts.text: Defendants 1 to 6 were members of undivided Hindu family known as Kalakkad Pannayar family in Tirunelveli District doing commission agency business in petrol, kerosene and crude oil with agency rights from Burmah-Shell Company.
Family became heavily indebted by about June 1936, leading to pressure from creditors.
Deed of composition EX. B.2 executed on July 8, 1936; 56 creditors agreed to scheme; defendant 7 constituted as trustee to take over assets, sell them and distribute proceeds rateably.
Creditor Ayyah Ayyar filed insolvency petition No. 26 of 1936 on July 30, 1936 in Sub-Court Tirunelveli against defendants 1 to 6.

Defendants 1 to 6 executed deed of trust EX.B.7 on August 26, 1936 conveying all movable and immovable properties to three trustees: defendant 7 Subbarayalu Reddiar, Veerabahu Pillai, Narayana Pillai, to dispose assets and distribute proceeds rateably.
Narayana Pillai died in February 1938; Veerabahu Pillai died before present suit.
Trustees accepted trust, took possession of immovable properties (except family house), paid secured creditors, arranged 50% payment to unsecured by selling properties.
Defendant 14 secured creditor; mortgage EX.B-95 for Rs.30,000 on June 3, 1935 at 10% compound interest; promissory note Rs.3,000 on July 17, 1935 at 12% interest supported by pledge.

Trustees conveyed Schedule I properties to defendant 14 for Rs.42,000 on May 22, 1937 EX.B-94 by two trustees (defendant 7 and Veerabahu); satisfied debts, balance Rs.3,030 for 50% dues of plaintiffs.

Defendant 7 creditor Rs.6,000, daughter-in-law Rs.2,000; trustees conveyed Schedule III to defendants 8,9,10 (sons of 7) EX.B.8 on Dec 16, 1936 for Rs.4,000; later sold to defendant 7 on May 30, 1947.
Defendant 12 (step-brother of Veerabahu) purchased Schedule V on Nov 7, 1941 for Rs.2,000 EX.B-90.
Defendant 13 (brother of 12) purchased Schedule II for Rs.15,000 on Aug 29, 1937 EX.B.37 by two trustees; another sale Schedule VIII? EX.B.79 Feb 1942 Rs.2,000.
Defendant 16 (son-in-law of 13) purchased Schedule VII and VII-A on May 7, 1943 EX.B-104 Rs.8,000 and June 4, 1943 EX.B-105 Rs.600.
Properties conveyed put into possession of purchasers.

Defendants 1-6 filed OS No.30/1943 in Sub-Court Tirunelveli for administration of trust, accounts, recovery; preliminary decree for accounts, no recovery of immovables; appeals AS 473,510,544/1944; HC remanded for market value findings Dec 20,1944; later withdrawn Dec 12,1947, suit dismissed.

Present suit filed Oct 29,1947 by three creditors on behalf of general body under O1 r8 for accounts, declaration properties impressed with trust, administration, remove trustee 7, appoint administrator, recover possession.

Trial court rejected accounts but declared schedules I-III,V,VII,VII-A,VIII impressed with trust, removed 7, appointed advocates as administrators, directed delivery of possession, re-sale, distribution; alienees entitled to consideration+interest, liable for profits.
HC appeals AS 720/1949 (def14 etc.), 731/1949 (12,13,16), 21/1950 (8-10,17); HC confirmed subject to modification on interest.
Both courts found alienations for inadequate consideration; EX B-94, B-37 invalid as by two trustees; transfers to relations of Veerabahu invalid; def12 trustee de son tort.
Def12 intermeddled: letters directing clerk Aug20,1936; to bank Oct14,1938, Jan9,1939; compromise in bank suit 1939; notice Ex P-7; receipt Ex121 Mar9,1937; possession from 1937.
Def13 EX B-25 Apr19,1937 Rs5000 51 items; sold to creditors incl Lakshmi Ammal; but lost in OS32/1941; EX B-79 to compensate.

legal_issues.text: Whether suit barred by limitation: Art 120 or Art 131/134?
Whether beneficiaries under private trust can sue for possession to new trustee or only declaration under s63 Trusts Act?
Whether barred by res judicata due to withdrawal of OS 30/1943?
Whether two out of three trustees can execute valid sale under cl23 trust deed and s48 Trusts Act?
Whether alienations for inadequate consideration and to relatives of trustee invalid under s52 Trusts Act?
Whether defendant 12 trustee de son tort?
Interest and profits: contract rate or equitable adjustment?

petitioner_arguments.text: Suit attracts Art 120 Limitation Act, barred by time.
Plaintiffs can only seek declaration under s63 Trusts Act, not possession.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Indian Trusts Act s63; Rani Chhatra Kumari Devi v. Prince Mohan Bikram Shah

petitioner_arguments.text: Barred by res judicata from OS 30/1943 withdrawal.
Cl23 trust deed allows majority to act, so two trustees valid.
Third trustee Narayana Pillai consented to sales EX B-94, B-37.
Def12 not trustee de son tort.
Contract rate interest 10.5% compound; mesne profits limited to 3 years Art109.

respondent_arguments.text: Suit under Art131/134 as claims possession via administrator.
Can seek removal of trustee, appoint new, delivery of possession; s63 not exhaustive.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Trusts Act s63; Limitation Act s10

respondent_arguments.text: No res judicata as representative suit under O1 r8, different parties.
All three trustees must join; cl23 requires all to act.
Alienations to relatives invalid; inadequate consideration.
Def12 intermeddled, trustee de son tort.

court_reasoning.text: Plaint claims possession to administrator, valued under s7(5) Court Fees Act; Art131 applies, within time.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Substance is claim for possession, not mere declaration.

court_reasoning.text: Beneficiaries can seek new trustee and delivery of property; s63 not exhaustive, avoids anomalous results.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Privy Council case not bar to such relief.

court_reasoning.text: No res judicata; representative suit, parties not same; s11 inapplicable.
court_reasoning.key_observation: General doctrine not apply to suits.

court_reasoning.text: Cl23 requires all three to act even on majority decision; s48 applies.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Translation shows 'you three shall act unanimously or by majority'.

court_reasoning.text: No consent by third trustee; concurrent findings.
Def12 intermeddled extensively (letters, compromises), trustee de son tort.
Sales to relatives invalid s52; inadequate consideration found concurrently; EX B-25 invalid, taints B-79.
Equitable adjustment: simple interest 10.5%, net profits from possession date, not limited by Art109.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Integral to decree avoiding further litigation.

holdings.text: Suit not barred by limitation; Art131 applies.
Beneficiaries entitled to possession to new trustee.
All trustees must join in execution; sales by two invalid.
Def12 trustee de son tort; sale invalid.
Alienations invalid for inadequate consideration, to relatives s52, delegation.
Equitable relief: simple interest, full net profits.

precedents_cited.case_name: A. Subramania Iyer v. P Nagarathna Naicker
precedents_cited.relevance: Beneficiaries can sue for possession to trustees.

precedents_cited.case_name: Masjid Shahid Ganj v. Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee
precedents_cited.relevance: Beneficiary right to recover property to custodians.

precedents_cited.relevance: Beneficiary not owner for possession under Art144.

precedents_cited.case_name: Subbaiya Pandaram v. Mahamad Mustapha Maracayar
precedents_cited.relevance: Declaration does not stop adverse possession.

Satgur Prasad v. Har Narain Das
Bhagwat Dayal Singh v. Debi Dayal Sahu

statutes_cited.name: Indian Trusts Act
statutes_cited.relevance: Joint execution by trustees; remedies for beneficiary; no self-dealing; no delegation.

statutes_cited.name: Limitation Act
statutes_cited.relevance: Limitation periods for declaration, possession, profits; special for trusts.

statutes_cited.name: Code of Civil Procedure
statutes_cited.relevance: Representative suits; res judicata; amendment; mortgage decrees.

outcome.summary: Both appeals dismissed with costs; confirmed HC decree declaring specified alienations invalid, properties impressed with trust, trustee 7 removed, administrators appointed, possession recovery and re-sale directed, alienees to receive consideration with simple interest 10.5%, account for net profits from possession date.
outcome.relief_granted: To respondents: administration of trust, recovery of properties; to alienees: equitable payment of dues with simple interest.

key_quotes.text: "In all the proceedings to be taken in connection with this estate, you three, either unanimously or according to the decision of the majority, shall act."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Translation of cl23 trust deed requiring all trustees to act.

key_quotes.text: "Section 63 no doubt provides for the two remedies which are available to the beneficiary, but in our opinion s. 63 cannot be treated as exhaustive."
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: "A very slight act of intermeddling with the goods of the deceased will make a person executor de son tort."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Citing Williams; applies to def12 as trustee de son tort.
